Wood-based products: Wood is a natural, renewable resource that can be used for a variety of products such as furniture, building materials, and packaging. Wood-based products are also biodegradable and do not harm the environment.
Metal-based products: Metals such as steel, aluminum, and titanium can be used to replace plastic in many applications. These materials are strong, durable, and can be recycled.
Glass-based products: Glass is a versatile material that can be used for everything from bottles to building materials. It is also recyclable and does not harm the environment.

Ceramic-based products: Ceramics are strong, durable, and can be used for a variety of products such as pottery, tiles, and building materials. They are also recyclable and do not harm the environment.
Natural fibers: Natural fibers such as cotton, hemp, and bamboo can be used to replace plastic in many applications. These materials are biodegradable, renewable, and do not harm the environment.
